contentrichtext.text: In mathematics, '''Artinian''', named for [[Emil Artin]], is an adjective that describes objects that satisfy particular cases of the [[descending chain condition]]. *A ring is an [[Artinian ring]] if it satisfies the descending chain condition on (one-sided) ideals *A module is an [[Artinian module]] if it satisfies the descending chain condition on submodules. ==See also== *[[Araz Artinian]], an Armenian-Canadian film maker and photographer {{disambiguation}} [[Category:Mathematical disambiguation]]
